intro: Glaucium flavum, commonly known as yellow hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided and covered in a waxy coating, giving them a distinctive appearance. Glaucium flavum is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in Mediterranean climates.
